intro: Corniola scorpius, commonly known as the scorpion grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Corniola scorpius is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and support local wildlife.
